titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the P.S. 50 John D. Wells School certificates and photograph 1991.005
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-08-25T09:54-0400

did.unittitle: P.S. 50 John D. Wells School certificates and photograph

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize box.

did.abstract: The P.S. 50 John D. Wells School certificates and photograph consists of two certificates and one oversized photograph. The certificates were awarded to Jeanette Brown from P.S. 50 John D. Wells School, 1918.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: John D. Wells Junior High School (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: P.S. 50 John D. Wells School was located in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn. As of 2011, it is now a junior high school--J.H.S. 50 John D. Wells School.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); P.S. 50 John D. Wells School certificates and photograph, 1991.005, Box and Folder number, Object ID number (if applicable); Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
This collection combines the accessions 1991.005 and V1991.002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The P.S. 50 John D. Wells School certificates and photograph consists of two certificates and one oversized photograph. The certificates were awarded to Jeanette Brown from P.S. 50 John D. Wells School, 1918. One certificate acknowledges the securing of subscriptions to the Third Liberty Loan, and the other certificate was awarded as an honor promotion. The photograph is an oversized black-and-white group portrait showing the 1918 graduating class at P. S. 50 John D. Wells School in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photograph has not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.
